heroContent.heading: Tech Stack
heroContent.subheading: Here's a look at the technologies I work with most often, what I'm currently learning, and what I’ve explored along the way. I aim to build things that are fast, scalable, and intuitive — and I believe the right tools make all the difference.

category.heading: Core Technologies
category.description: Technologies I use regularly and feel confident with.

technology.name: Next.js
technology.description: My go-to framework for web development

technology.name: TypeScript
technology.description: Strictly typed code is my standard — TypeScript helps me catch issues early while building scalable apps.

technology.name: Tailwind CSS
technology.description: I use Tailwind CSS almost instinctively — it’s my preferred way to build clean, consistent, and responsive UIs.

technology.name: React
technology.description: Though I don’t use React directly much, it’s the foundation of Next.js — so I’m fully comfortable with its core concepts.

technology.name: JavaScript
technology.description: I’m equally confident writing in plain JavaScript — it complements my TypeScript usage and expands compatibility.

category.heading: Currently Learning
category.description: Technologies I’m currently exploring to go full-stack.

technology.name: Express
technology.description: I’m learning Express to build full-stack apps and better understand backend fundamentals.

technology.name: MongoDB
technology.description: As part of my journey into full-stack development, I’m exploring MongoDB as a flexible, modern NoSQL database.

technology.name: Swift
technology.description: To develop native apps across Apple platforms, I’ve started learning Swift — a step toward full native mobile development.

category.heading: Also Familiar With
category.description: Technologies I’ve worked with in academic or side projects.

technology.name: Java
technology.description: My favorite programming language. I studied it for over a year at university and still enjoy writing in it.

technology.name: C++
technology.description: I use C++ primarily to program microcontrollers in my DIY hardware projects.

technology.name: HTML
technology.description: HTML is the foundation of the web — I know it thoroughly and treat it as second nature.

technology.name: CSS
technology.description: CSS was one of the first tools I mastered, and it continues to be a key part of my frontend work alongside Tailwind.

technology.name: Angular
technology.description: Angular was the first framework I explored. While it felt complex at first, I appreciated its component-based philosophy.

technology.name: Android Framework
technology.description: I’ve worked with the Android Framework in university and personal projects — it’s one of the reasons I love Java so much.

toolsContent.heading: Tools I Use
toolsContent.subheading: My day-to-day tools for development, version control, and deployment.
